p: Children are one of the most vulnerable groups in the general population, as they are exposed to high health risks during their growth. Adequate nutrition is one of the factors with the greatest impact on children’s health, and nutritional deficits are responsible, directly or indirectly, for more than 60% of the 10 million deaths of children under five years of age. In this context, it is important to emphasize that educational interventions in basic health care and healthy eating associated with biochemical exams and blood counts would have an important contribution to children’s health [ 34, 35].
